review_text: The shower had hair from previous guest upon our arrival. The bathroom mirror was streaked and dirty. Bathroom sink finish was chipped in several places giving it the appearance of not being clean. Toilet did not flush right. We reported the wifi was bad and it never really worked correctly on our phones. Host claimed this was not a problem with other guests . Afterwards I checked reviews and noticed at least one other person mentioned this too. Not set up for anyone to do much of anything simple in the kitchen. Dishes and silverware were not clean. Had to soak the coffee mugs to get the dirt scrubbed out of the mugs. Patio for guests was not set up as pictured. The table and chairs were in the back yard with a patio rug draped over them. Assigned parking space was located under a tree that needed trimmed so guests had to deal with the low branches being in the way. Not responsive to our emails. When we received her welcome greeting we indicated when we would be arriving.

Gilbert and Freehand Cellars are worth a visit and thereâ€™s some good Mexican Food available within a couple blocks walk. We enjoyed El Porton (huge portions) and Yakima Steak Company (very good steak). Natalie was very responsive and shared some good insights on what to do in the area. We enjoyed the enclosed patio as it provided the perfect sun spot in the afternoon to chill at. If we find ourselves in Yakima again, this would be my first choice.

review_text: A great Airbnb for 1 or 2 adults in Yakima! There weren't a lot of great options in Yakima between hotels and other Airbnbs, and I'm glad I found this spot. The place was very clean, nicely decorated, and well-equipped with little thoughtful touches that made our stay really comfortable. I loved the nice clean bathroom, which had good lighting, an extra handheld mirror, lots of extra towels, and even lint rollers! I was also impressed that there were some live houseplants in the apartment. The owners care about this place! The kitchen was perfect for our needs, including a full-size fridge, dishwasher, and an oven/range. The bed was comfortable as well! There is a bit of street/car noise that comes through, but it didn't bother me (I'm used to living in a city). We didn't actually get to check out Bill's Place (the bar), but it looked cool, so hopefully next time! The apartment doesn't look like much from the outside, but it really is a nice place to stay.

review_text: Thoroughly pleased, that's how I'd describe my feelings about my stay at Natalie's place in Yakima. Communication from the start--and throughout the stay--was very quick, sometimes measured in minutes. And it was always friendly. Everything was clearly communicated through texting with her or from the information she posted in the Airbnb website/app. The place itself was super-clean, and even better inside than it looked in the pictures. I was particularly impressed with many of the nice small touches she put into the place. Just walking into the space on a hot day, I got a very good vibe when I realized the room was pre-cooled to a calming 70 degrees. The only detail I think that could be a minus for some is the immediate surroundings. However, if you read the description, you will realize that your front area is a parking lot and you're a few steps away from a bar. This is, however, also a plus--depending on your way of thinking/living!

Two week stay at Natalie's place and it was amazing. For a location where there's a fair amount of traffic around and a bar across the parking lot, the apartment itself was very peaceful to stay in and most of the noise wouldn't even be noticeable. Great location to start and end your day in, with great coffee across the road and Bill's Place to get some drinks in the evening and mingle with a lot of great folks. Good amount of food places and a small corner store/gas station within walkable distance as well.
The apartment itself was amazing and very well kept! Very clean, great modern kitchen, nice details and decorations to make it feel like a home away from home for my two weeks there. Overall just very very comfortable.
Natalie was an awesome host! Very friendly, very sociable and reachable, went out of her way with Doug to take me explore local breweries, and gave me great tips on what was happening in and around town during my stay.
Thank you Nat & Doug for an amazing experience!

review_text: Natalieâ€™s darling apartment is a surprise in all the best ways. The secure, gated entrance with a petite porch sitting area gives way to a perfectly beautiful, well-appointed and perfectly maintained living space. Comfortable, nicely decorated, and every detail thoughtfully done. The AC worked well and was a comfort coming in from a hot Yakima summer day. The bathroom is stellar with gorgeous fixtures and luxurious towels. It is nicer than many high-end hotels! Natalie is a host that clearly takes great pride in offering a lovely space with all necessities included. The industrial neighborhood is a mix of blue collar businesses and some other modest living spaces. It was quiet and our party of three women felt safe and secure. Natalie also made sure we had plenty of information about options for dining and enjoying local favorites. This listing is highly recommended!

The selling point is "Dive Bar" but there is nothing "Dive" about this place!!! You get the "Dive" appearance of the bar being right in the middle of everything but it is actually very upscale. The staff is top shelf, they are polite and very attentive, drinks are delicious and plentiful, and the food is AMAZING!! Everything we had was perfectly prepared and delicious, we saw so many other dishes we wanted to try but ran out of time. We will definitely be going back !! The room was very modern and comfortable and extremely clean and peaceful. Natalie and Doug are wonderful people and hopefully you will get to meet them during your stay!! I can't say enough positive things about the entire visit, this was a definite winner in my book. We enjoyed delicious breakfasts at 2 close by cafes.Thank you Natalie and Doug!!!!

The beds were cozy with lots of extra pillows and blankets as well as extra charging cords for all of our devices and the bathrooms were very clean and well stocked as well.

review_text: We have stayed at a number of airbnbs over the years and think Heather's home might be the best one we've discovered. We hosted a family reunion while we were there, and Heather immediately offered additional outdoor chairs and table that were exactly what we needed for our gathering. The backyard isn't huge, but it is charming, beautiful and private whether you want to sit on the covered patio or by the pretty fountain, grill dinner or play a game of corn hole. The house itself has everything you need. The kitchen has plenty of dishes, glasses, cookware, dishtowels, etc. not to mention cooking staples. The bedrooms are clean, comfortable and even include charging stations. The house is beautifully decorated in a way that makes you feel at home while still being pampered. We wish all airbnbs were like this one!

This house was in a great location, close to grocery stores, Starbucks, and other things. Quiet neighborhood. The yard was very beautiful and inviting. I wish it had been warmer so I could have sat on the patio in the morning and enjoyed my coffee, it was so beautiful.
There were a few things that I recommended to Autumn for the next guests, and she promptly got right on them. The heating ducts in the kitchen were quite noisy, and woke me up one morning, thinking that someone was in the house, but it was just the heater coming on and rattling things in the kitchen. Couldnâ€™t believe how large the TV was in the living room, but if you donâ€™t have a streaming thing, then thereâ€™s not much to watch due to the inability to have over the air or cable TV in that location. But that is explained in her description. I thought Autumn was very friendly and responsive and would not hesitate to stay here again. Thank you.

We especially enjoyed the east facing backyard with the morning light in the kitchen. The lawn was freshly mowed when we got there and it was obvious the house is well taken care of.
The kids enjoyed the bunk beds, kids books, and the games. The house felt roomy with just 4 of us and was very comfortable.
It was a very pleasant stay and I'm sure we will be back!

review_text:
GREAT PLACE. Quiet street. Well maintained street. Nothing seemed far away.
We went to several breweries (the goal of our visit) and hiked in the Canyon.
We enjoyed TAMALES in Union Gap and lots of MEXICAN food. (also a goal of the visit).
The Greenway Trail along the river is great. Bring a bike or walk/run. We parked at the Arboretum.
Yakima is becoming one of our favorite long weekend destinations because of the beer and wine in the area.
NOTE...there's only one bathroom...so if your group is LARGE...keep that in mind.

review_text: I really wanted to like this place, but it was pretty bad. The house itself was fine, it was cute and pretty tidy, tvs in every room, lots of dishes etc. There was a lot of hair in one of the beds and the bunk bed is so rickety it seems dangerous. I could have overlooked that but the house stinks soooo bad. It smells wet and musty which is strange because Yakima is a pretty dry place, not much humidity. We left there Monday and four days later, my hair still reeks of this house. Iâ€™ve washed it multiple times too. All of our clothes, suitcases, back packs, jackets, everything still reeks of this house even after washing. I spoke with the owner about it and they knew of this issue. They knew the bunk bed wasnâ€™t sturdy. Autumn was very nice about all of my concerns and very responsive, but they still know about all of these issues and rent the house out anyway. I wouldnâ€™t be surprised if thereâ€™s some serious mold in the house. They even have moisture absorbing bags in every single closet. They know thereâ€™s a problem.

The homeless people we encountered didn't give us a second glance, but we did have to ask a woman to leave as she was taking shelter right in front of the front door. There is also a lot of noise, some of it unpleasant, from the residential unit next door. Hosts were very prompt with their communication and even allowed for an early check-in. review_text:
This is a really neat stay in a converted church!
I stayed 2 days and really enjoyed the renovated studio -- it was very spacious! It was well stocked with utensils and kitchen ware, and the bed was comfortable. I was grateful for the provided earplugs as there is a group home (or something similar) next to the church, so there is a bit of human activity right outside the window (people out smoking and homeless, the latter of which I was prepared for from other reviews and the listing). The only detractor was the shower -- although the bathroom is spacious, the shower head had very low water flow with erratic spray and only 1 setting, which made bathing a longer-than-expected experience.
For a stay in Yakima, I really enjoyed how easy the location was to find, the parking was convenient, and I found it very walkable to get food and explore. The next time I'm in town, I'd love to say here again!

This place was INCREDIBLE! Honestly, everything about it was perfect. The communication with the host was top-notch and they went above and beyond to share more about the location, the details, and amenities. The place was so cool and comfortable, and felt like the perfect getaway. We walked for about 15 minutes down the canal to the local tasting room, Freehand Cellars, and had a wonderful evening there, then hung out at the Airbnb in their two chairs by the firepit. The attention to detail from the hosts was what really set this place apart - the home is designed beautifully, there are excellent toiletries and accompaniments, etc. If you are looking for a getaway with fun wineries, hikes, and relaxation, then don't look anywhere else.
P.S. Before we booked this, I asked my husband if we were willing to spend $50+ more for something really special because I had a hunch it was going to be a much better experience than some of the other listings. I am so glad we spent more!

The only thing we wish for is for the place look a little more like a guest house rather than a converted garage. You drive past a beautiful house on the hill with a deck with a great view, and then realize this is not where you're actually staying but in what looks like a garage down the driveway. The first impression is "Did I make a mistake?". However, once you see the patio view on the side, the contemporary way the building was remodeled, park and walk in, all concerns go away as the living space is really cool and very comfortable. Also, the views are amazing!
All in all, a really positive experience, and we look forward to coming back someday when we can spend more time enjoying everything on offer.

We didnâ€™t cook during our stay but everything you could need is there! I loved everything so much we took photos of different product so that we are able to buy, and I may have even requested links on pillows and bedding! We will absolutely be staying again and telling all of our friends and family! Thank you, Taylorâ€™s for offering such a space on our valley!

review_text:
Josh has done great things with this rental. The interior was comfortable and extra clean. Even the mattresses were nice to sleep on. I think they have done everything possible to make it comfortable inside. I loved the big bathroom as well.
The one thing that cannot be changed about the place is the location. It is commercial/industrial and that is what you see out every window. We weren't comfortable opening any windows because of the views and occasionally the people driving by/stopping. One night, two of the neighbor's guard dogs barked all night long which made it incredibly difficult to sleep.
Overall, it is a decent value for what is offered, but I would choose to pay a bit more to be in a better location where security and noise were less of an issue.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
Josh's place was a great little spot for us to sleep a couple nights while in town for a marching band competition. Inside was very clean and appeared newly remodeled. Everything was clean and tidy, and it had some basic cooking items. Perhaps oddly specific, but the non-stick pots and pans were AMAZING, lol.
The only weird part is that it's located in an odd part of town. Not sure what Yakima is doing with their zoning laws, but this house is smack in the middle of a fairly industrial area (with other mixed residential dwellings). The property is fenced and it has a full-on security system, which is great, but it feels a bit intense. It was nice to park our vehicle behind the locked gate. I think the price very much accounts for this oddity and I think staying here was an exceptionally good deal. It's also VERY close to the historic downtown area, which was really nice.
For our use case of just spending a couple days in town, this worked really well!

Safety was great as well - there was a working alarm system & a gate we could lock as we came in/out of the house. Would love to stay here again if/when I am back in Yakima - thank you Josh & team for wonderful weekend accommodations!

review_text: Robin's Nest was so perfect for our stay! Sherry has truly made an accomodation that feels like home away from home. We take our dog with us 95% of the time, so have stayed at a myriad of "pet friendly" locations, but Robin's Nest is by far the best Yakima has to offer with; dog beds up & downstairs, food/water station, designated pooch towels & most importantly, a FULLY fenced back yard. The was only the 3 of us (2 bipeds & 1 quadruped), so had plenty of room. The balance Sherry created maintaining the character of an adorable, older house while beautifully outfitting with updated fixtures, faucets & appliances throughout is nothing short of amazing to me. If family hadn't been the reason we made the trip, we might not have left the property. It's in a tucked back, peaceful neighborhood & centrally located for easy access to anywhere in town. We have only praise, no complaints. Hope that we will be welcome back, because I know where I want to stay anytime we're in Yakima from now on.

The neighborhood was so nice and residential, while still being just a few blocks from Franklin park, which has tennis and pickle ball courts, as well as a ton of space to play fetch with our dog. The back yard was also great for our pup and had a covered area where we ate and took calls throughout the day. The neighbors were kind and friendly, and the entire stay really made us feel at home. We had such lovely sunsets with the tasting room (outside area) all to ourselves after hours and THEN we just happened to be there when they had their second Moonlight party. The belly dancers were goddesses, the DJ knew exactly who was on the dancefloor (all my fellow 30-40 year olds, we all felt like we were back in college) and then they brought out delicious macarons, it just felt like someone's wedding. My girlfriends and I had the absolute BEST time, thank you so much. I highly recommend staying here! And the coffee recommendations were spot on.

review_text:
We absolutely loved our friend-cation at Freehand Cellars! The place was so spacious and adorable. I don't remember seeing the arcade machine in the listing, but we LOVED that it was there! I especially loved having our own private hot tub! We opted for the delivered wine tasting, and when there was a hiccup in delivery, the tasting room was quick to bring it over when we called to inquire. It was so special to have the wine tasting and snacks delivered to us! The kitchen was fantastic and had all the amenities. The couch was big enough for us both to sprawl out. Beds comfy. We loved it all!
Just a note, we could hear the neighbors in the attached duplex the first night while we were watching TV in the living room. They weren't unnecessarily loud, I think there were just a handful of them and the sound carried. For us, their conversations were hilarious but the wrong tenants could be less fun probably.
Would stay here again, loved the space and the amenities!

Eduardo even left a note wishing us a merry Christmas, set up a tree, and left us some holiday cookies! We werenâ€™t able to be with family for the holiday, but Eduardo made us feel right at home.
The tasting room we didnâ€™t take advantage of, but it was only steps away from our front door. They even had EV charging spots!
10/10 would book again.

review_text: A family member had a volleyball tournament in Yakima, and we decided to head over to see her play! It was fairly last minute, but fortunately there was a beautiful house available about 10 minutes away. I read the reviews, checked out the maps and it looked perfect. About a day before, we saw that the game started at 8am, but the house was rented the night before...but Eduardo helped us with another rental they owned on the property (booking through airbnb of course) and even offered to help move our luggage between rentals (we didn't have much since we were there for such a short period). If you are looking to cook at all during your stay, the kitchen is incredible! Very modern, all the appliances you would need and the view from the dining room table - is impressive. Honestly, they have everything you need for all rooms and more! Definitely will stay again when we go to Yakima :)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Awesome stay on beautiful grounds! My friends and I enjoyed our stay and the ability to explore and have the property pretty much to ourselves outside of Freehand tasting room hours was perfect. There are 2 other airbnbs on the property. One next door in the duplex, the other out of sight. The Freehand staff were all very friendly. The patio is not private as the duplex is next to the tasting room. It did not bother us, we explored during the day. Again had the place for hours in the morning and after 7 or so. Kitchen well equipped for cooking. Pantry items supplied: coffee, sugar, creamer, salt and pepper. Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and laundry supplies provided as well. If you are looking for completely updated and immaculate property, this may not be for you. Mid century modern/grandmas house vibe with updated kitchen. All the amenities needed being away from home, hot tub was nice too. Would definitely stay again!

review_text: We enjoyed our overnight stay at Eduardoâ€™s place at Freehand Cellars and wished we could have stayed another night as originally planned (no fault of the host). After a very long drive we enjoyed a delicious charcuterie plate we purchased next door at the tasting room. And had we been able to stay longer we wouldâ€™ve enjoyed more time at the tasting room with its beautiful view and comfortable seating. Had the weather been warmer we would have spent more time on the deck & enjoyed more of the lovely view across the vineyard. And, although we didnâ€™t make use if it that night we did have a nice hot tub. On a clear night the stars must be awesome! The beds were extremely comfortable and the living room spacious but not particularly cozy, the kitchen full of light, very spacious with a nice view from the table. Having two bathrooms with showers was a plus but the shower door & faucet in one could use a little TLC or updating to make them a little easier to manage. Although we never saw our host, Eduardoâ€™s communication was very good with us and directions very clear on how to get there and get in.

review_text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 days. Although we arrived late on a Sunday and we're not able to enjoy the wine tasting as it closes at 5 on Sunday and doesn't reopen until Wednesday the grounds were beautiful and very private and peaceful. The rental itself is as described, we thoroughly enjoyed the fabulous view, hot tub, orchards and vineyards, we made dinner on the first night in the upgraded kitchen and it had everything we needed to make a delicious meal. We liked the bed, it was firm and we had a good night's rest. We got up early the second day to enjoy our coffee and the sunrise which was lovely. We drove a short distance to Union Gap for takeout and came back for the sunset. All in all a very relaxing time and would stay here again. Thank you for hosting us.

name: Zachary
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
November 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Pros:
- The location was very convenient to both the Rattlesnake AVA/Yakima Valley and the city of Yakima.
- The views from the deck over the valley were beautiful, in particular towards sundown from unit A. The deck included a larger hot tub which was very relaxing to use in the evenings.
- The unit was spacious and a lot of natural light in the living space, while the rooms faced north keeping them more secluded from the light.
- Modern TV and comfortable couch were very nice to have in the evenings to relax and enjoy a glass of wine. There was also a Nintendo gaming machine that we did not use, but looked pretty cool.
- Full selection of cooking/eating/drinking materials, although one of the saute pans was no longer flat making it hard to use effectively.
- Eduardo was very responsive and getting in/out of the place was a breeze. Note that parking is not available next to unit, but you can load/unload and it is a very short walk to the parking space.

Cons:
- The unit looked and felt somewhat dated and there were areas that appeared to need repair/upkeep. There have been updates in places, such as the cabinetry in the kitchen, but many much older fixtures/areas that could be improved. For instance, the sliding door in the shower is no longer on tracks and is difficult to open/close and there was no pillow variety available, which didn't work for everyone.
- While it feels secluded, the road noise from the highway out on the deck is very noticeable, especially in the evenings.
Summary: While we would not likely stay again in Unit A as a two-some, it is a good unit especially if you have a child with whom could take advantage of the twin beds and gaming machine, or a larger group. We are very interested in the Airstream option at Freehand as well, which was not available for our stay. The hot tub and view are great and it has all the right pieces, it just needs a little more work to make it great.
